musicalLanguage.description: A slow, deeply expressive blues in Bb that demands advanced harmonic vocabulary and emotional phrasing. At 60 BPM, every beat is an eternity — you must fill the space with intention. Rich 9th and 13th voicings, chromatic passing tones, and gospel-influenced turnarounds make this a graduate-level blues study.
musicalLanguage.structure: Slow 12-bar blues with substitutions. This excerpt: 8 bars
keyMoments: Bar 1-2: Bb9 — wide voicings with the 9th and 13th. The slow tempo demands rich harmony.
Bar 3-4: Chromatic approach and grace notes — filling the slow tempo with expression
Bar 5-6: Eb9 — the IV chord with jazz-gospel color changes
Bar 7-8: Bb9 with chromatic inner movement — sophisticated voice leading
teachingGoals: Filling slow tempos with expressive ornaments and grace notes
Chromatic voice leading between blues changes
Gospel turnaround influence in blues piano
styleTips: At 60 BPM, time stretches — fill it with intent, not filler
Grace notes and ornaments should be vocal — think of a singer bending notes
Use sustain pedal to let rich voicings ring and blend
Dynamic range matters more at slow tempos — use the full spectrum

measures.teachingNote: Bb9 — rich voicing with the 9th (C) on top. The Ab-A grace note is a blue note smear into the major 3rd.

measures.leftHand: Bb2:q F3 Ab3 D4:q Bb2:q F3:q
measures.teachingNote: Bb9 — melody descends through chord extensions. Every note sings at this tempo.

measures.leftHand: Bb2:q F3 Ab3:q D3 Ab3:q Bb2:q
measures.teachingNote: Bb13 — Db slides into D (blue 3rd to major 3rd). G is the 13th. Left hand moves through different voicings.
Bb9 — phrase settles. Half note on F5 lets the rich harmony bloom underneath.
Eb9 — IV chord with the same lush treatment. Db-D blue note smear appears again.
Eb9 — descending through the IV chord tones. Db is the b7. Let the phrase sigh.

measures.leftHand: Bb2:q F3 Ab3 D4:q Bb2:q D3:q
measures.teachingNote: Bb9 — back to the tonic with an ascending line reaching up to C6 (the 9th above).

measures.leftHand: Bb2:q F3 Ab3 D4:q Bb2:q F3:q
measures.teachingNote: Bb9 — ornamental descent with grace notes. The Ab-G is a chromatic passing tone. Settle into the resolution.
